section.name: Introduction
section.p: NeuClear is an umbrella project to create various technologies to enable a truely distributed future of electronic commerce. The NeuClear ID project is a new simplified PKI system to help try to enable the kinds applications that people have been talking about the last 10 years, but never got of the ground due to usability and logistical reasons.

section.name: [12th of December 2003] Milestone Release 0.8
section.p: Panama City, 12th of December, 2003. We are happy to announce the milestone 0.8 release of NeuClear ID. Major new features are:

ul.li: Developers Tools for creating ID's and certifying others
Easy to integrate User Authentication filter for Web frameworks
Added Jakarta Cactus web unit tests
Major cleanup work has been done throughout the API. API changes should only be minimal in the future.

section.p: The goal of this release has been in particular to make it easier for application developers, to start providing support for NeuClear. Download it today and join in the NeuClear revolution.

section.name: Busy Developer Guide
section.p: We are working on expanding our documentation now. Besides expanding our API Documentation, we also now have a busy developers guide. Aimed to get developers started with their own Identities quickly and easily.

section.name: Road Map
section.p: Our aim for the next version 0.9 is to stabilize and freeze the underlying xml formats and standards as well as to create more userland tools. Thus the goal is to fix the underlying format making it easier for other implementations of NeuClear ID. This should be reached early on in January 2004
Our goal is for 1.0 the following release to be fairly polished from a usability standpoint. Our goal is to release this in February 2004.
